metadata.title: CVE-2017-9083 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
poppler 0.54.0, as used in Evince and other products, has a NULL pointerdereference in the JPXStream::readUByte function in JPXStream.cc. Forexample, the perf_test utility will crash (segmentation fault) when parsingan invalid PDF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.5').
luatex: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
